|八女市岩戸山歴史文化交流館|Yame-shi Iwatoyama Rekishi Bunka Kōryū-kan}}, also known in English as Iwatoyama Historical and Cultural Community Center, and nicknamed , is a culture centre with a museum space that opened in Yame, Fukuoka, Japan in 2015. It supersedes and replaces the former , which opened on another site in the vicinity in 1984 and closed in 2015, after attracting some 300,000 visitors. Located next to Iwatoyama Kofun, the new facility has spaces for a variety activities and events and a permanent exhibition that focuses on , the Iwai Rebellion, and ancient Yame, with exhibits including sekijin sekiba from Yame Kofun Cluster.
See also
* Kyushu Historical Museum
* Kyushu National Museum
* Itokoku History Museum
